meanings.definition: To fill with water and sink
meanings.sent1: The small boat foundered in the stormy sea.
meanings.sent2: The old ship foundered after hitting a rock.
meanings.sent3: The bathtub foundered under the weight of too many toys.
meanings.sent4: Her hopes foundered like a shipwreck on the shore.
meanings.sent5: The leak caused the boat to slowly founder and disappear beneath the waves.

meanings.sent1: He foundered on the uneven ground and fell.
meanings.sent2: The tired horse foundered at the end of the race.
meanings.sent3: The robot foundered over its own wires, crashing to the floor.
meanings.sent4: His confidence foundered, and he struggled to regain his balance.
meanings.sent5: The tower of blocks foundered with a loud crash, startling everyone nearby.

meanings.sent1: The plan foundered due to lack of support.
meanings.sent2: The negotiations foundered on a single point of disagreement.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at humor foundered, leaving an awkward silence.
meanings.sent4: Their relationship foundered under the weight of constant arguments.
meanings.sent5: The engine foundered, leaving them stranded in the middle of nowhere.

meanings.sent1: She foundered on too much cake at the party.
meanings.sent2: The dog foundered on the treats left out on the table.
meanings.sent3: The cat foundered on the stolen tuna cans, looking guilty.
meanings.sent4: He foundered on the buffet, regretting his lack of self-control.
meanings.sent5: The guests foundered on the lavish feast, groaning with full stomachs.
